005package edu.wpi.first.math;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.jni.EigenJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import org.ejml.MatrixDimensionException;
011import org.ejml.data.DMatrixRMaj;
012import org.ejml.dense.row.CommonOps_DDRM;
013import org.ejml.dense.row.MatrixFeatures_DDRM;
014import org.ejml.dense.row.NormOps_DDRM;
015import org.ejml.dense.row.factory.DecompositionFactory_DDRM;
016import org.ejml.interfaces.decomposition.CholeskyDecomposition_F64;
017import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
018
019/**
020 * A shape-safe wrapper over Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) matrices.
021 *
022 * <p>This class is intended to be used alongside the state space library.
023 *
024 * @param <R> The number of rows in this matrix.
025 * @param <C> The number of columns in this matrix.
026 */
027public class Matrix<R extends Num, C extends Num> {
028  /** Storage for underlying EJML matrix. */
029  protected final SimpleMatrix m_storage;
030
031  /**
032   * Constructs an empty zero matrix of the given dimensions.
033   *
034   * @param rows The number of rows of the matrix.
035   * @param columns The number of columns of the matrix.
036   */
037  public Matrix(Nat<R> rows, Nat<C> columns) {
038    this.m_storage =
039        new SimpleMatrix(
040            Objects.requireNonNull(rows).getNum(), Objects.requireNonNull(columns).getNum());
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs a new {@link Matrix} with the given storage. Caller should make sure that the
045   * provided generic bounds match the shape of the provided {@link Matrix}.
046   *
047   * @param rows The number of rows of the matrix.
048   * @param columns The number of columns of the matrix.
049   * @param storage The double array to back this value.
050   */
051  public Matrix(Nat<R> rows, Nat<C> columns, double[] storage) {
052    this.m_storage = new SimpleMatrix(rows.getNum(), columns.getNum(), true, storage);
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Constructs a new {@link Matrix} with the given storage. Caller should make sure that the
057   * provided generic bounds match the shape of the provided {@link Matrix}.
058   *
059   * <p>NOTE:It is not recommend to use this constructor unless the {@link SimpleMatrix} API is
060   * absolutely necessary due to the desired function not being accessible through the {@link
061   * Matrix} wrapper.
062   *
063   * @param storage The {@link SimpleMatrix} to back this value.
064   */
065  public Matrix(SimpleMatrix storage) {
066    this.m_storage = Objects.requireNonNull(storage);
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Constructs a new matrix with the storage of the supplied matrix.
071   *
072   * @param other The {@link Matrix} to copy the storage of.
073   */
074  public Matrix(Matrix<R, C> other) {
075    this.m_storage = Objects.requireNonNull(other).getStorage().copy();
076  }
077
078  /**
079   * Gets the underlying {@link SimpleMatrix} that this {@link Matrix} wraps.
080   *
081   * <p>NOTE:The use of this method is heavily discouraged as this removes any guarantee of type
082   * safety. This should only be called if the {@link SimpleMatrix} API is absolutely necessary due
083   * to the desired function not being accessible through the {@link Matrix} wrapper.
084   *
085   * @return The underlying {@link SimpleMatrix} storage.
086   */
087  public SimpleMatrix getStorage() {
088    return m_storage;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Gets the number of columns in this matrix.
093   *
094   * @return The number of columns, according to the internal storage.
095   */
096  public final int getNumCols() {
097    return this.m_storage.getNumCols();
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Gets the number of rows in this matrix.
102   *
103   * @return The number of rows, according to the internal storage.
104   */
105  public final int getNumRows() {
106    return this.m_storage.getNumRows();
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Get an element of this matrix.
111   *
112   * @param row The row of the element.
113   * @param col The column of the element.
114   * @return The element in this matrix at row,col.
115   */
116  public final double get(int row, int col) {
117    return this.m_storage.get(row, col);
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Sets the value at the given indices.
122   *
123   * @param row The row of the element.
124   * @param col The column of the element.
125   * @param value The value to insert at the given location.
126   */
127  public final void set(int row, int col, double value) {
128    this.m_storage.set(row, col, value);
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Sets a row to a given row vector.
133   *
134   * @param row The row to set.
135   * @param val The row vector to set the given row to.
136   */
137  public final void setRow(int row, Matrix<N1, C> val) {
138    this.m_storage.setRow(row, 0, Objects.requireNonNull(val).m_storage.getDDRM().getData());
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Sets a column to a given column vector.
143   *
144   * @param column The column to set.
145   * @param val The column vector to set the given row to.
146   */
147  public final void setColumn(int column, Matrix<R, N1> val) {
148    this.m_storage.setColumn(column, 0, Objects.requireNonNull(val).m_storage.getDDRM().getData());
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Sets all the elements in "this" matrix equal to the specified value.
153   *
154   * @param value The value each element is set to.
155   */
156  public void fill(double value) {
157    this.m_storage.fill(value);
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Returns the diagonal elements inside a vector or square matrix.
162   *
163   * <p>If "this" {@link Matrix} is a vector then a square matrix is returned. If a "this" {@link
164   * Matrix} is a matrix then a vector of diagonal elements is returned.
165   *
166   * @return The diagonal elements inside a vector or a square matrix.
167   */
168  public final Matrix<R, C> diag() {
169    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.diag());
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * Returns the largest element of this matrix.
174   *
175   * @return The largest element of this matrix.
176   */
177  public final double max() {
178    return CommonOps_DDRM.elementMax(this.m_storage.getDDRM());
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Returns the absolute value of the element in this matrix with the largest absolute value.
183   *
184   * @return The absolute value of the element with the largest absolute value.
185   */
186  public final double maxAbs() {
187    return CommonOps_DDRM.elementMaxAbs(this.m_storage.getDDRM());
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * Returns the smallest element of this matrix.
192   *
193   * @return The smallest element of this matrix.
194   */
195  public final double minInternal() {
196    return CommonOps_DDRM.elementMin(this.m_storage.getDDRM());
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Calculates the mean of the elements in this matrix.
201   *
202   * @return The mean value of this matrix.
203   */
204  public final double mean() {
205    return this.elementSum() / this.m_storage.getNumElements();
206  }
207
208  /**
209   * Multiplies this matrix with another that has C rows.
210   *
211   * <p>As matrix multiplication is only defined if the number of columns in the first matrix
212   * matches the number of rows in the second, this operation will fail to compile under any other
213   * circumstances.
214   *
215   * @param other The other matrix to multiply by.
216   * @param <C2> The number of columns in the second matrix.
217   * @return The result of the matrix multiplication between "this" and the given matrix.
218   */
219  public final <C2 extends Num> Matrix<R, C2> times(Matrix<C, C2> other) {
220    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.mult(Objects.requireNonNull(other).m_storage));
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Multiplies all the elements of this matrix by the given scalar.
225   *
226   * @param value The scalar value to multiply by.
227   * @return A new matrix with all the elements multiplied by the given value.
228   */
229  public Matrix<R, C> times(double value) {
230    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.scale(value));
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Returns a matrix which is the result of an element by element multiplication of "this" and
235   * other.
236   *
237   * <p>c<sub>i,j</sub> = a<sub>i,j</sub>*other<sub>i,j</sub>
238   *
239   * @param other The other {@link Matrix} to perform element multiplication on.
240   * @return The element by element multiplication of "this" and other.
241   */
242  public final Matrix<R, C> elementTimes(Matrix<R, C> other) {
243    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.elementMult(Objects.requireNonNull(other).m_storage));
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Subtracts the given value from all the elements of this matrix.
248   *
249   * @param value The value to subtract.
250   * @return The resultant matrix.
251   */
252  public final Matrix<R, C> minus(double value) {
253    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.minus(value));
254  }
255
256  /**
257   * Subtracts the given matrix from this matrix.
258   *
259   * @param value The matrix to subtract.
260   * @return The resultant matrix.
261   */
262  public final Matrix<R, C> minus(Matrix<R, C> value) {
263    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.minus(Objects.requireNonNull(value).m_storage));
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Adds the given value to all the elements of this matrix.
268   *
269   * @param value The value to add.
270   * @return The resultant matrix.
271   */
272  public final Matrix<R, C> plus(double value) {
273    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.plus(value));
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Adds the given matrix to this matrix.
278   *
279   * @param value The matrix to add.
280   * @return The resultant matrix.
281   */
282  public final Matrix<R, C> plus(Matrix<R, C> value) {
283    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.plus(Objects.requireNonNull(value).m_storage));
284  }
285
286  /**
287   * Divides all elements of this matrix by the given value.
288   *
289   * @param value The value to divide by.
290   * @return The resultant matrix.
291   */
292  public Matrix<R, C> div(int value) {
293    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.divide(value));
294  }
295
296  /**
297   * Divides all elements of this matrix by the given value.
298   *
299   * @param value The value to divide by.
300   * @return The resultant matrix.
301   */
302  public Matrix<R, C> div(double value) {
303    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.divide(value));
304  }
305
306  /**
307   * Calculates the transpose, Mᵀ of this matrix.
308   *
309   * @return The transpose matrix.
310   */
311  public final Matrix<C, R> transpose() {
312    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.transpose());
313  }
314
315  /**
316   * Returns a copy of this matrix.
317   *
318   * @return A copy of this matrix.
319   */
320  public final Matrix<R, C> copy() {
321    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.copy());
322  }
323
324  /**
325   * Returns the inverse matrix of "this" matrix.
326   *
327   * @return The inverse of "this" matrix.
328   * @throws org.ejml.data.SingularMatrixException If "this" matrix is non-invertable.
329   */
330  public final Matrix<R, C> inv() {
331    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.invert());
332  }
333
334  /**
335   * Returns the solution x to the equation Ax = b, where A is "this" matrix.
336   *
337   * <p>The matrix equation could also be written as x = A<sup>-1</sup>b. Where the pseudo inverse
338   * is used if A is not square.
339   *
340   * <p>Note that this method does not support solving using a QR decomposition with full-pivoting,
341   * as only column-pivoting is supported. For full-pivoting, use {@link
342   * #solveFullPivHouseholderQr}.
343   *
344   * @param <C2> Columns in b.
345   * @param b The right-hand side of the equation to solve.
346   * @return The solution to the linear system.
347   */
348  public final <C2 extends Num> Matrix<C, C2> solve(Matrix<R, C2> b) {
349    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.solve(Objects.requireNonNull(b).m_storage));
350  }
351
352  /**
353   * Solves the least-squares problem Ax=B using a QR decomposition with full pivoting, where this
354   * matrix is A.
355   *
356   * @param <R2> Number of rows in B.
357   * @param <C2> Number of columns in B.
358   * @param other The B matrix.
359   * @return The solution matrix.
360   */
361  public final <R2 extends Num, C2 extends Num> Matrix<C, C2> solveFullPivHouseholderQr(
362      Matrix<R2, C2> other) {
363    Matrix<C, C2> solution = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(this.getNumCols(), other.getNumCols()));
364    EigenJNI.solveFullPivHouseholderQr(
365        this.getData(),
366        this.getNumRows(),
367        this.getNumCols(),
368        other.getData(),
369        other.getNumRows(),
370        other.getNumCols(),
371        solution.getData());
372    return solution;
373  }
374
375  /**
376   * Computes the matrix exponential using Eigen's solver. This method only works for square
377   * matrices, and will otherwise throw an {@link MatrixDimensionException}.
378   *
379   * @return The exponential of A.
380   */
381  public final Matrix<R, C> exp() {
382    if (this.getNumRows() != this.getNumCols()) {
383      throw new MatrixDimensionException(
384          "Non-square matrices cannot be exponentiated! "
385              + "This matrix is "
386              + this.getNumRows()
387              + " x "
388              + this.getNumCols());
389    }
390    Matrix<R, C> toReturn = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(this.getNumRows(), this.getNumCols()));
391    EigenJNI.exp(
392        this.m_storage.getDDRM().getData(),
393        this.getNumRows(),
394        toReturn.m_storage.getDDRM().getData());
395    return toReturn;
396  }
397
398  /**
399   * Computes the matrix power using Eigen's solver. This method only works for square matrices, and
400   * will otherwise throw an {@link MatrixDimensionException}.
401   *
402   * @param exponent The exponent.
403   * @return The exponential of A.
404   */
405  public final Matrix<R, C> pow(double exponent) {
406    if (this.getNumRows() != this.getNumCols()) {
407      throw new MatrixDimensionException(
408          "Non-square matrices cannot be raised to a power! "
409              + "This matrix is "
410              + this.getNumRows()
411              + " x "
412              + this.getNumCols());
413    }
414    Matrix<R, C> toReturn = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(this.getNumRows(), this.getNumCols()));
415    EigenJNI.pow(
416        this.m_storage.getDDRM().getData(),
417        this.getNumRows(),
418        exponent,
419        toReturn.m_storage.getDDRM().getData());
420    return toReturn;
421  }
422
423  /**
424   * Returns the determinant of this matrix.
425   *
426   * @return The determinant of this matrix.
427   */
428  public final double det() {
429    return this.m_storage.determinant();
430  }
431
432  /**
433   * Computes the Frobenius normal of the matrix.
434   *
435   * <p>normF = Sqrt{ &sum;<sub>i=1:m</sub> &sum;<sub>j=1:n</sub> { a<sub>ij</sub><sup>2</sup>} }
436   *
437   * @return The matrix's Frobenius normal.
438   */
439  public final double normF() {
440    return this.m_storage.normF();
441  }
442
443  /**
444   * Computes the induced p = 1 matrix norm.
445   *
446   * <p>||A||<sub>1</sub>= max(j=1 to n; sum(i=1 to m; |a<sub>ij</sub>|))
447   *
448   * @return The norm.
449   */
450  public final double normIndP1() {
451    return NormOps_DDRM.inducedP1(this.m_storage.getDDRM());
452  }
453
454  /**
455   * Computes the sum of all the elements in the matrix.
456   *
457   * @return Sum of all the elements.
458   */
459  public final double elementSum() {
460    return this.m_storage.elementSum();
461  }
462
463  /**
464   * Computes the trace of the matrix.
465   *
466   * @return The trace of the matrix.
467   */
468  public final double trace() {
469    return this.m_storage.trace();
470  }
471
472  /**
473   * Returns a matrix which is the result of an element by element power of "this" and b.
474   *
475   * <p>c<sub>i,j</sub> = a<sub>i,j</sub> ^ b
476   *
477   * @param b Scalar.
478   * @return The element by element power of "this" and b.
479   */
480  public final Matrix<R, C> elementPower(double b) {
481    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.elementPower(b));
482  }
483
484  /**
485   * Returns a matrix which is the result of an element by element power of "this" and b.
486   *
487   * <p>c<sub>i,j</sub> = a<sub>i,j</sub> ^ b
488   *
489   * @param b Scalar.
490   * @return The element by element power of "this" and b.
491   */
492  public final Matrix<R, C> elementPower(int b) {
493    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.elementPower(b));
494  }
495
496  /**
497   * Extracts a given row into a row vector with new underlying storage.
498   *
499   * @param row The row to extract a vector from.
500   * @return A row vector from the given row.
501   */
502  public final Matrix<N1, C> extractRowVector(int row) {
503    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.extractVector(true, row));
504  }
505
506  /**
507   * Extracts a given column into a column vector with new underlying storage.
508   *
509   * @param column The column to extract a vector from.
510   * @return A column vector from the given column.
511   */
512  public final Matrix<R, N1> extractColumnVector(int column) {
513    return new Matrix<>(this.m_storage.extractVector(false, column));
514  }
515
516  /**
517   * Extracts a matrix of a given size and start position with new underlying storage.
518   *
519   * @param <R2> Number of rows to extract.
520   * @param <C2> Number of columns to extract.
521   * @param height The number of rows of the extracted matrix.
522   * @param width The number of columns of the extracted matrix.
523   * @param startingRow The starting row of the extracted matrix.
524   * @param startingCol The starting column of the extracted matrix.
525   * @return The extracted matrix.
526   */
527  public final <R2 extends Num, C2 extends Num> Matrix<R2, C2> block(
528      Nat<R2> height, Nat<C2> width, int startingRow, int startingCol) {
529    return new Matrix<>(
530        this.m_storage.extractMatrix(
531            startingRow,
532            startingRow + Objects.requireNonNull(height).getNum(),
533            startingCol,
534            startingCol + Objects.requireNonNull(width).getNum()));
535  }
536
537  /**
538   * Extracts a matrix of a given size and start position with new underlying storage.
539   *
540   * @param <R2> Number of rows to extract.
541   * @param <C2> Number of columns to extract.
542   * @param height The number of rows of the extracted matrix.
543   * @param width The number of columns of the extracted matrix.
544   * @param startingRow The starting row of the extracted matrix.
545   * @param startingCol The starting column of the extracted matrix.
546   * @return The extracted matrix.
547   */
548  public final <R2 extends Num, C2 extends Num> Matrix<R2, C2> block(
549      int height, int width, int startingRow, int startingCol) {
550    return new Matrix<>(
551        this.m_storage.extractMatrix(
552            startingRow, startingRow + height, startingCol, startingCol + width));
553  }
554
555  /**
556   * Assign a matrix of a given size and start position.
557   *
558   * @param <R2> Rows in block assignment.
559   * @param <C2> Columns in block assignment.
560   * @param startingRow The row to start at.
561   * @param startingCol The column to start at.
562   * @param other The matrix to assign the block to.
563   */
564  public <R2 extends Num, C2 extends Num> void assignBlock(
565      int startingRow, int startingCol, Matrix<R2, C2> other) {
566    this.m_storage.insertIntoThis(
567        startingRow, startingCol, Objects.requireNonNull(other).m_storage);
568  }
569
570  /**
571   * Extracts a submatrix from the supplied matrix and inserts it in a submatrix in "this". The
572   * shape of "this" is used to determine the size of the matrix extracted.
573   *
574   * @param <R2> Number of rows to extract.
575   * @param <C2> Number of columns to extract.
576   * @param startingRow The starting row in the supplied matrix to extract the submatrix.
577   * @param startingCol The starting column in the supplied matrix to extract the submatrix.
578   * @param other The matrix to extract the submatrix from.
579   */
580  public <R2 extends Num, C2 extends Num> void extractFrom(
581      int startingRow, int startingCol, Matrix<R2, C2> other) {
582    CommonOps_DDRM.extract(
583        other.m_storage.getDDRM(), startingRow, startingCol, this.m_storage.getDDRM());
584  }
585
586  /**
587   * Decompose "this" matrix using Cholesky Decomposition. If the "this" matrix is zeros, it will
588   * return the zero matrix.
589   *
590   * @param lowerTriangular Whether we want to decompose to the lower triangular Cholesky matrix.
591   * @return The decomposed matrix.
592   * @throws RuntimeException if the matrix could not be decomposed(i.e. is not positive
593   *     semidefinite).
594   */
595  public Matrix<R, C> lltDecompose(boolean lowerTriangular) {
596    SimpleMatrix temp = m_storage.copy();
597
598    CholeskyDecomposition_F64<DMatrixRMaj> chol =
599        DecompositionFactory_DDRM.chol(temp.getNumRows(), lowerTriangular);
600    if (!chol.decompose(temp.getMatrix())) {
601      // check that the input is not all zeros -- if they are, we special case and return all
602      // zeros.
603      var matData = temp.getDDRM().data;
604      var isZeros = true;
605      for (double matDatum : matData) {
606        isZeros &= Math.abs(matDatum) < 1e-6;
607      }
608      if (isZeros) {
609        return new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(temp.getNumRows(), temp.getNumCols()));
610      }
611
612      throw new RuntimeException("Cholesky decomposition failed! Input matrix:\n" + m_storage);
613    }
614
615    return new Matrix<>(SimpleMatrix.wrap(chol.getT(null)));
616  }
617
618  /**
619   * Returns the row major data of this matrix as a double array.
620   *
621   * @return The row major data of this matrix as a double array.
622   */
623  public double[] getData() {
624    return m_storage.getDDRM().getData();
625  }
626
627  /**
628   * Creates the identity matrix of the given dimension.
629   *
630   * @param dim The dimension of the desired matrix as a {@link Nat}.
631   * @param <D> The dimension of the desired matrix as a generic.
632   * @return The DxD identity matrix.
633   */
634  public static <D extends Num> Matrix<D, D> eye(Nat<D> dim) {
635    return new Matrix<>(SimpleMatrix.identity(Objects.requireNonNull(dim).getNum()));
636  }
637
638  /**
639   * Creates the identity matrix of the given dimension.
640   *
641   * @param dim The dimension of the desired matrix as a {@link Num}.
642   * @param <D> The dimension of the desired matrix as a generic.
643   * @return The DxD identity matrix.
644   */
645  public static <D extends Num> Matrix<D, D> eye(D dim) {
646    return new Matrix<>(SimpleMatrix.identity(Objects.requireNonNull(dim).getNum()));
647  }
648
649  /**
650   * Reassigns dimensions of a {@link Matrix} to allow for operations with other matrices that have
651   * wildcard dimensions.
652   *
653   * @param <R1> Row dimension to assign.
654   * @param <C1> Column dimension to assign.
655   * @param mat The {@link Matrix} to remove the dimensions from.
656   * @return The matrix with reassigned dimensions.
657   */
658  public static <R1 extends Num, C1 extends Num> Matrix<R1, C1> changeBoundsUnchecked(
659      Matrix<?, ?> mat) {
660    return new Matrix<>(mat.m_storage);
661  }
662
663  /**
664   * Checks if another {@link Matrix} is identical to "this" one within a specified tolerance.
665   *
666   * <p>This will check if each element is in tolerance of the corresponding element from the other
667   * {@link Matrix} or if the elements have the same symbolic meaning. For two elements to have the
668   * same symbolic meaning they both must be either Double.NaN, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, or
669   * Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
670   *
671   * <p>NOTE:It is recommended to use {@link Matrix#isEqual(Matrix, double)} over this method when
672   * checking if two matrices are equal as {@link Matrix#isEqual(Matrix, double)} will return false
673   * if an element is uncountable. This method should only be used when uncountable elements need to
674   * be compared.
675   *
676   * @param other The {@link Matrix} to check against this one.
677   * @param tolerance The tolerance to check equality with.
678   * @return true if this matrix is identical to the one supplied.
679   */
680  public boolean isIdentical(Matrix<?, ?> other, double tolerance) {
681    return MatrixFeatures_DDRM.isIdentical(
682        this.m_storage.getDDRM(), other.m_storage.getDDRM(), tolerance);
683  }
684
685  /**
686   * Checks if another {@link Matrix} is equal to "this" within a specified tolerance.
687   *
688   * <p>This will check if each element is in tolerance of the corresponding element from the other
689   * {@link Matrix}.
690   *
691   * <p>tol &ge; |a<sub>ij</sub> - b<sub>ij</sub>|
692   *
693   * @param other The {@link Matrix} to check against this one.
694   * @param tolerance The tolerance to check equality with.
695   * @return true if this matrix is equal to the one supplied.
696   */
697  public boolean isEqual(Matrix<?, ?> other, double tolerance) {
698    return MatrixFeatures_DDRM.isEquals(
699        this.m_storage.getDDRM(), other.m_storage.getDDRM(), tolerance);
700  }
701
702  /**
703   * Performs an inplace Cholesky rank update (or downdate).
704   *
705   * <p>If this matrix contains L where A = LLᵀ before the update, it will contain L where LLᵀ = A +
706   * σvvᵀ after the update.
707   *
708   * @param v Vector to use for the update.
709   * @param sigma Sigma to use for the update.
710   * @param lowerTriangular Whether this matrix is lower triangular.
711   */
712  public void rankUpdate(Matrix<R, N1> v, double sigma, boolean lowerTriangular) {
713    EigenJNI.rankUpdate(this.getData(), this.getNumRows(), v.getData(), sigma, lowerTriangular);
714  }
715
716  @Override
717  public String toString() {
718    return m_storage.toString();
719  }
720
721  /**
722   * Checks if an object is equal to this {@link Matrix}.
723   *
724   * <p>a<sub>ij</sub> == b<sub>ij</sub>
725   *
726   * @param other The Object to check against this {@link Matrix}.
727   * @return true if the object supplied is a {@link Matrix} and is equal to this matrix.
728   */
729  @Override
730  public boolean equals(Object other) {
731    return this == other
732        || other instanceof Matrix<?, ?> matrix
733            && !MatrixFeatures_DDRM.hasUncountable(matrix.m_storage.getDDRM())
734            && MatrixFeatures_DDRM.isEquals(this.m_storage.getDDRM(), matrix.m_storage.getDDRM());
735  }
736
737  @Override
738  public int hashCode() {
739    return Objects.hash(m_storage);
740  }
741}
